meanings.definition: A person who fills a fuel tank.
meanings.sent1: The fueller at the gas station filled up my car's tank.
meanings.sent2: The fueller quickly refilled the aircraft's fuel tank before takeoff.
meanings.sent3: The fueller joked that filling up tanks was his fuel for the day.
meanings.sent4: She was a fueller of hearts, always filling them with love and kindness.
meanings.sent5: The fueller's job is crucial to keep vehicles running smoothly.

meanings.definition: A device used for filling fuel tanks.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used a fueller to top up the generator's tank.
meanings.sent2: The fueller was designed to prevent spills while refueling boats.
meanings.sent3: The bright red fueller stood out among the other tools in the shed.
meanings.sent4: The fueller hummed as it efficiently transferred fuel into the tank.
meanings.sent5: Make sure to always have a reliable fueller in your emergency kit.

meanings.sent1: I need to fueller the car before we head out on the road trip.
meanings.sent2: He carefully fuellered the lawnmower with gasoline for the first time.
meanings.sent3: She decided to fueller up the truck even though it still had some fuel left.
meanings.sent4: The old truck sputtered as it was fuellered with diesel for the last time.
meanings.sent5: Remember to fueller your vehicle regularly to avoid running out of gas unexpectedly.
